a.g: Nun. By the pen and what they inscribe,
You are not, [O Muhammad], by the favor of your Lord, a madman.
And indeed, for you is a reward uninterrupted.
And indeed, you are of a great moral character.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
بيان فضيلة حسن الخلق ومذمة سوء الخلق قال الله تعالى لنبيه وحبيبه مثنياً عليه ومظهراً نعمته لديه "وإنك لعلى خلق عظيم" وقالت عائشة رضي الله عنها كان رسول الله ﭬ خلقه القرآن وسأل رجل رسول الله ﭬ عن حسن الخلق فتلا قوله تعالى "خذ العفو وأمر بالعرف واعرض عن الجاهلين" ثم قال ﭬ "هو أن تصل قطعك وتعطي من حرمك وتعفو ظلمك" وقال ﭬ: "إنما بعثت لأتمم مكارم الأخلاق" وقال ﭬ "أُقل ما يوضع في الميزان يوم القيامة تقوى الله وحسن الخلق" وجاء رجل إلى رسول الله ﭬ من بين يديه فقال: يا رسول الله ما الدين؟ قال "حسن الخلق" فأتاه من قبل يمينه فقال: يا رسول الله ما الدين؟ قال "حسن الخلق" ثم أتاه من قبل شماله فقال: ما الدين؟ فقال "حسن الخلق" ثم أتاه من ورائه فقال يا رسول الله ما الدين؟ فالتفت إليه وقال "أما تفقه؟ هو أن لا تغضب" وقيل "يا رسول الله ما الشؤم؟ قال "سوء الخلق" وقال رجل لرسول الله ﭬ: أوصني فقال "اتق الله حيثما كنت" قال زدني قال "أتبع السيئة تمحها" قال زدني قال "خالق الناس بخلق حسن" وسئل عليه السلام: أي الأعمال أفضل؟ قال "خلق حسن" وقال ﭬ "ما حسن الله خلق عبد وخلقه فيطعمه النار" وقال الفضيل قيل لرسول الله صلى الله عليه وعلى آله وسلم: إن فلانة تصوم النهار وتقوم الليل وهي سيئة الخلق تؤذي جيرانها بلسانها قال "لا خير فيها هي من أهل النار" وقال أبو الدرداء سمعت رسول الله ﭬ يقول "أول ما يوضع في الميزان حسن الخلق والسخاء ولما خلق الله الإيمان قال اللهم قوني فقواه بحسن الخلق والسخاء، ولما خلق الله الكفر قال اللهم قوني فقواه بالبخل وسوء الخلق" وقال ﭬ "إن الله استخلص هذا الدين لنفسه ولا يصلح لدينكم إلا السخاء وحسن الخلق ألا فزينوا دينكم بهما" وقال عليه السلام "حسن الخلق خلق الله الأعظم" وقيل: "يا رسول الله أي المؤمنين أفضل إيماناً؟ قال "أحسنهم خلقاً" وقال ﭬ "إنكم لن تسعوا الناس بأموالكم فسعوهم ببسط الوجه وحسن الخلق" وقال أيضاً ﭬ "سوء الخلق يفسد العمل"
Indeed, "And indeed, you are of a great character [khuluq 'azim]." And 'A'ishah, may God be pleased with her, said: The Messenger of God, peace be upon him, his character [khuluq] was the Qur'an. And a man asked the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, about good character [husn al-khuluq], so he recited His saying, the Exalted: "Take what is easy, enjoin what is good, and turn away from the ignorant." Then he, peace be upon him, said: "It is that you join with one who cuts you off, and you give to one who deprives you, and you pardon one who wrongs you." And he, peace be upon him, said: "I was only sent to perfect noble character traits [makarim al-akhlaq]." And he, peace be upon him, said: "The heaviest thing to be placed in the Scale [mizan] on the Day of Resurrection [Yawm al-Qiyamah] is God-consciousness [taqwa] and good character [husn al-khuluq]." And a man came to the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, from before him and said: O Messenger of God, what is religion [din]? He said: "Good character [husn al-khuluq]." Then he came to him from his right side and said: O Messenger of God, what is religion [din]? He said: "Good character [husn al-khuluq]." Then he came to him from his left side and said: What is religion [din]? He said: "Good character [husn al-khuluq]." Then he came to him from behind him and said: O Messenger of God, what is religion [din]? He turned to him and said: "Do you not understand? It is that you do not become angry." And it was said: "O Messenger of God, what is misfortune?" He said: "Bad character [su' al-khuluq]." And a man said to the Messenger of God, peace be upon him: Advise me. He said: "Be conscious of God [ittaqu Llah] wherever you are." He said: Increase me. He said: "Follow a bad deed with a good deed to erase it." He said: Increase me. He said: "Interact with people with good character [khuluq hasan]." And he, upon him be peace, was asked: Which deeds are best? He said: "Good character [khuluq hasan]." And he, peace be upon him, said: "When God beautifies the creation [khalq] of a servant and his character [khuluq], He does not feed him to the Fire [Nar]." And al-Fudayl said: It was said to the Messenger of God, peace be upon him and his family: So-and-so fasts the day and prays the night, but she is of bad character [sai'at al-khuluq], harming her neighbors with her tongue. He said: "There is no good in her. She is from the people of the Fire [Ahl al-Nar]." And Abu al-Darda' said: I heard the Messenger of God, peace be upon him, say: "The first thing to be placed in the Scale [mizan] is good character [husn al-khuluq] and generosity [sakha']. And when God created faith [iman], it said: O God, strengthen me. So He strengthened it with good character [husn al-khuluq] and generosity [sakha']. And when God created disbelief [kufr], it said: O God, strengthen me. So He strengthened it with stinginess [bukhl] and bad character [su' al-khuluq]." And he, peace be upon him, said: "Indeed, God has chosen this religion [din] for Himself, and nothing is suitable for your religion [din] except generosity [sakha'] and good character [husn al-khuluq]. Behold, so adorn your religion [din] with them." And he, upon him be peace, said: "Good character [husn al-khuluq] is the greatest creation [khalq] of God." And it was said: "O Messenger of God, which of the believers has the best faith [iman]?" He said: "The best of them in character [khuluq]." And he, peace be upon him, said: "You will not encompass people with your wealth, so encompass them with a cheerful face and good character [husn al-khuluq]." And he also, peace be upon him, said: "Bad character [su' al-khuluq] corrupts deeds."

a.g: So you will see and they will see
Which of you is the afflicted [by a devil].
Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has gone astray from His way, and He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.
Then do not obey the deniers.
They wish that you would soften [in your position], so they would soften [toward you].
And do not obey every worthless habitual swearer
[And] scorner, going about with malicious gossip -
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
الآفة السادسة عشرة النميمة قال الله تعالى "هماز مشاء بنميم" ثم قال "عتل بعد ذلك زنيم" قال عبد الله بن المبارك: الزنيم ولد الزنا الذي لا يكتم الحديث، وأشار به إلى أن كل من لم يكتم الحديث ومشى بالنميمة دل على أنه ولد زنا استنباطاً من قوله عز وجل "عتل بعد ذلك زنيم" والزنيم هو الدعى وقال تعالى "ويل لكل همزة لمزة" قيل الهمزة: النمام، وقال تعالى "حمالة الحطب" قيل إنها كانت نمامة حمالة للحديث وقال تعالى "فخانتاهما فلم يغنيا عنهما من الله شيئاً" قيل كانت امرأة لوط تخبر بالضيفان وامرأة نوح تخبر أنه مجنون وقد قال ﭬ "لا يدخل الجنة نمام" وفي حديث آخر "لا يدخل الجنة قتات" والقتات هو النمام وقال أبو هريرة قال رسول الله ﭬ "أحبكم إلى الله أحاسنكم أخلاقاً الموطئون أكنافاً الذين يألفون ويؤلفون، وإن أبغضكم إلى الله المشاءون بالنميمة، المفرقون بين الإخوان، الملتمسون للبرءاء العثرات" وقال ﭬ "ألا أخبركم بشراركم" قالوا: بلى، قال "المشاءون بالنميمة المفسدون بين الأحبة الباغون للبرءاء العيب" وقال أبو ذر: قال رسول الله ﭬ "من أشاع على مسلم كلمة ليشينه بها بغير حق شانه الله بها في النار يوم القيامة" وقال أبو الدرداء: قال رسول الله ﭬ "أيما رجل أشاع على رجل كلمة وهو منها بريء ليشينه بها في الدنيا كان حقاً على الله أن يذيبه بها يوم القيامة في النار" وقال أبو هريرة: قال رسول الله ﭬ "من شهد على مسلم بشهادة ليس لها بأهل فليتبوأ مقعده من النار" ويقال: إن ثلث عذاب القبر من النميمة. وعن ابن عمر عن النبي ﭬ "إن الله لما خلق الجنة قال لها تكلمي فقالت سعد من دخلني فقال الجبار جل جلاله وعزتي وجلالي لا يسكن فيك ثمانية نفر من الناس، لا يسكنك مدمن خمر ولا مصر على الزنا ولا قتات وهو النمام ولا ديوث ولا شرطي ولا مخنث ولا قاطع رحم ولا الذي يقول على عهد الله إن لم أفعل كذا وكذا لم يف به"
Indeed, the sixteenth affliction is tale-bearing [an-namima]. Allah the Exalted says: "A slanderer [hammaz], a spreader of calumny [masha’ bi-namim]" (68:11). Then He says: "Surly, and after that, ignoble [zanīm]" (68:13). Abdullah ibn al-Mubarak said: "The ignoble one [az-zanīm] is the child of fornication who does not conceal speech." He indicated by this that everyone who does not conceal speech and goes about with tale-bearing [namima] shows that he is a child of fornication, deduced from His saying, the Mighty and Majestic: "Surly, and after that, ignoble [zanīm]." And the ignoble one [az-zanīm] is the falsely attributed one [ad-da'ī]. And the Exalted says: "Woe to every slanderer [hammaza] and backbiter [lumaza]" (104:1). It is said: The slanderer [al-hammaz] is the tale-bearer [an-nammām]. And the Exalted says: "The carrier of firewood [hamalata al-hatab]" (111:4). It is said she was a tale-bearer [nammama], a carrier of speech [hamalata lil-hadith]. And the Exalted says: "But they betrayed them, so they availed them nothing against Allah" (66:10). It is said: The wife of Lot used to inform about the guests, and the wife of Noah used to inform that he was mad. And He, peace be upon him, said: "The tale-bearer [an-nammām] will not enter Paradise." And in another hadith: "The slanderer [al-qattāt] will not enter Paradise." And the slanderer [al-qattāt] is the tale-bearer [an-nammām]. And Abu Hurairah said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "The most beloved of you to Allah are the best of you in character [akhlaq], the most accommodating, those who befriend and are befriended. And the most hateful of you to Allah are those who go about with tale-bearing [al-masha’ūn bi-n-namīma], those who separate between brothers, those who seek out the faults of the innocent." And He, peace be upon him, said: "Shall I not inform you of the worst of you?" They said: Yes. He said: "Those who go about with tale-bearing [al-masha’ūn bi-n-namīma], those who cause corruption between loved ones, those who seek fault in the innocent." And Abu Dharr said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Whoever spreads a word about a Muslim to disgrace him with it without right, Allah will disgrace him with it in the Fire on the Day of Resurrection." And Abu ad-Darda’ said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Any man who spreads a word about a man while he is innocent of it, to disgrace him with it in the world [ad-dunya], it is a right upon Allah to melt him with it on the Day of Resurrection in the Fire." And Abu Hurairah said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Whoever bears witness against a Muslim with testimony for which he is not worthy, let him take his seat in the Fire." And it is said: One-third of the punishment of the grave is from tale-bearing [an-namīma]. And from Ibn ‘Umar, from the Prophet, peace be upon him: "Indeed, when Allah created Paradise, He said to it: 'Speak.' So it said: 'Fortunate is he who enters me.' So the Compeller, glory and majesty be to Him, and by His might and grandeur, said: 'Eight types of people from mankind will not dwell in you: the addicted to wine, the persistent in fornication, the slanderer [al-qattāt]—and he is the tale-bearer [an-nammām]—the panderer, the policeman, the effeminate man, the severer of kinship ties, and he who says concerning Allah's covenant: 'If I do not do such and such...' and then does not fulfill it.'"

a.g: A preventer of good, transgressing and sinful,
Cruel, moreover, and an illegitimate pretender.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
قال الله تعالى "هماز مشاء بنميم" ثم قال "عتل بعد ذلك زنيم" قال عبد الله بن المبارك: الزنيم ولد الزنا الذي لا يكتم الحديث، وأشار به إلى أن كل من لم يكتم الحديث ومشى بالنميمة دل على أنه ولد زنا استنباطاً من قوله عز وجل "عتل بعد ذلك زنيم" والزنيم هو الدعى.
Indeed, "a slanderer [humaz], a spreader of calumny [masha' bi-namim]." Then He said, "coarse, and after all that, base-born [zanim]." Abdullah ibn al-Mubarak said: The base-born one [al-zanim] is the child of fornication [walad al-zina] who does not conceal speech. And he indicated by this that everyone who does not conceal speech and walks with slander [namima] demonstrates that he is a child of fornication, deduced from the saying of the Almighty, "coarse, and after all that, base-born [zanim]." And the base-born one [al-zanim] is the falsely attributed one [al-da'iyy].

a.g: Because he is a possessor of wealth and children,
When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
We will brand him upon the snout.
Indeed, We have tried them as We tried the companions of the garden, when they swore to cut its fruit in the [early] morning
Without making exception.
So there came upon the garden an affliction from your Lord while they were asleep.
And it became as though reaped.
And they called one another at morning,
[Saying], "Go early to your crop if you would cut the fruit."
So they set out, while lowering their voices,
[Saying], "There will surely not enter it today upon you [any] poor person."
And they went early in determination, [assuming themselves] able.
But when they saw it, they said, "Indeed, we are lost;
Rather, we have been deprived."
The most moderate of them said, "Did I not say to you, 'Why do you not exalt [Allah]?' "
They said, "Exalted is our Lord! Indeed, we were wrongdoers."
Then they approached one another, blaming each other.
They said, "O woe to us; indeed we were transgressors.
Perhaps our Lord will substitute for us [one] better than it. Indeed, we are toward our Lord desirous."
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وتقول عند الخسران ﴿ عسى ربنا أن يبدلنا خيرا منها إنا إلى ربنا راغبون ﴾
Indeed, when loss [khusrān] befalls you, say: "Perhaps our Lord will replace it for us with something better. Indeed, we are to our Lord turning in desire [rāghibūn]."

a.g: Such is the punishment [of this world]. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.
Indeed, for the righteous with their Lord are the Gardens of Pleasure.
Then will We treat the Muslims like the criminals?
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فلو خرجت من مكمن الغرور وأنصفت نفسك يا رجل وكلنا ذلك الرجل لعلمت أنك من حين تصبح إلى حين تمسي لا تسعى إلا في الحظوظ العاجلة ولا تتحرك ولا تسكن إلا لعاجل الدنيا ثم تطمع أن تكون غدا من أمته وأتباعه وما أبعد ظنك وما أبرد طمعك ﴿ أفنجعل المسلمين كالمجرمين ما لكم كيف تحكمون ﴾
Indeed, if you were to emerge from the hiding place of delusion [ghurur] and be just with your own soul [nafs], O man—and we are all that man—you would know that from the moment you rise until the moment you retire, you strive for nothing but immediate gains [al-huzuz al-'ajilah], and you neither move nor rest except for the immediate concerns of this world [al-dunya]. Then you aspire that tomorrow you will be among his community and his followers? How distant is your assumption, and how cold is your hope! **"Then will We treat those who have submitted like the criminals? What is [wrong] with you? How do you judge?"**

a.g: What is [the matter] with you? How do you judge?
Or do you have a scripture in which you learn
That indeed for you is whatever you choose?
Or do you have oaths [binding] upon Us, extending until the Day of Resurrection, that indeed for you is whatever you judge?
Ask them which of them, for that [claim], is responsible.
Or do they have partners? Then let them bring their partners, if they should be truthful.
The Day the shin will be uncovered and they are invited to prostration but the disbelievers will not be able,
Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. And they used to be invited to prostration while they were sound.
So leave Me, [O Muhammad], with [the matter of] whoever denies the Qur'an. We will progressively lead them [to punishment] from where they do not know.
And I will give them time. Indeed, My plan is firm.
Or do you ask of them a payment, so they are by debt burdened down?
Or have they [knowledge of] the unseen, so they write [it] down?
Then be patient for the decision of your Lord, [O Muhammad], and be not like the companion of the fish when he called out while he was distressed.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
وقد عاتب الله نبيه ﷺ في الإعراض عن عبد والإقبال على عبد، وهما في العبودية سيان ولكن في الحال مختلفان، فقال: " وأما من جاءك يسعى وهو يخشى فأنت عنده تلهى "، وقال في الآخر: " أما من استغنى فأنت له تصدى " وكذلك أمره بالقعود مع طائفة، فقال عز وجل: " وإذا جاءك الذين يؤمنون بآياتنا فقل سلام عليكم " وأمره بالإعراض عن غيرهم، فقال: " وإذا رأيت الذين يخوضون في آياتنا فأعرض عنهم " حتى قال: " فلا تقعد بعد الذكرى مع القوم الظالمين " وقال تعالى: " واصبر نفسك مع الذين يدعون ربهم بالغداة والعشي ". فكذلك الانبساط والإدلال يحتمل من بعض العباد دون بعض. فمن انبساط الأنس قول موسى عليه السلام: " إن هي إلا فتنتك تضل بها من تشاء وتهدي من تشاء " وقوله في التعليل والاعتذار لما قيل له: " اذهب إلى فرعون "، فقال: " ولهم على ذنب " وقوله: " إني أخاف أن يكذبون ويضيق صدري ولا ينطلق لساني "، وقوله: " إننا نخاف أن يفرط علينا أو أن يطغى " وهذا من غير موسى عليه السلام من سوء الأدب لأن الذي أقيم مقام الأنس يلاطف ويحتمل، ولم يحتمل ليونس عليه السلام ما دون هذا لما أقيم مقام القبض والهيبة، فعوقب بالسجن في بطن الحوت - في ظلمات ثلاث - ونودي عليه إلى يوم القيامة " لولا أن تداركه نعمة من ربه لنبذ بالعراء وهو مذموم ". قال الحسن: العراء هو القيامة. ونهى نبينا ﷺ أن يقتدى به وقيل له: " فاصبر لحكم ربك ولا تكن كصاحب الحوت إذ نادى وهو مكظوم ".
Indeed, God reproved His Prophet ﷺ for turning away from one servant and turning towards another, though in servitude [‘ubudiyya] they are equal, yet in their state [hal] they differ. So He said: "But as for he who comes to you striving [while he fears [God], from him you are distracted." And regarding the other, He said: "As for he who thinks himself self-sufficient, to him you give attention." Likewise, He commanded him to sit with a group, for the Almighty said: "And when those come to you who believe in Our signs, say, 'Peace be upon you.'" And He commanded him to turn away from others, saying: "And when you see those who engage in [offensive] discourse concerning Our signs, then turn away from them," until He said: "Then do not sit, after the reminder, with the wrongdoing people." And God said: "And restrain yourself with those who call upon their Lord in the morning and the evening." So too, expansiveness [inbisat] and intimate boldness [idlal] are permissible from some worshippers [‘ibad] and not from others. Among the expressions of intimate familiarity [uns] is the saying of Moses, peace be upon him: "It is not but Your trial [fitna]; You send astray with it whom You will and guide whom You will," and his statement giving a reason and excuse when it was said to him, "Go to Pharaoh," and he said, "And upon me is a sin [dhanb]," and his saying, "Indeed, I fear that they will deny me and that my breast will tighten and my tongue will not be fluent," and his saying, "Indeed, we fear that he will hasten [punishment] against us or that he will transgress." This, from someone other than Moses, peace be upon him, would be poor etiquette [su’ al-adab], for the One established in the place of intimate familiarity [uns] is gentle and forbearing. Yet, for Jonah, peace be upon him, less than this was not borne, for he was established in the place of constriction [qabd] and awe [hayba], so he was punished with imprisonment in the belly of the fish—in threefold darkness—and was called out to until the Day of Resurrection: "If not that a favor from his Lord had reached him, he would have been cast onto the bare shore while blameworthy." Al-Hasan said: "The bare shore [‘ara’] is the Resurrection." And our Prophet ﷺ was forbidden from being followed in this, and it was said to him: "Then be patient for the decree of your Lord and do not be like the companion of the fish when he called out while he was distressed."

a.g: If not that a favor from his Lord overtook him, he would have been thrown onto the naked shore while he was censured.
a.ihya:
Tafsir Al-Ihya
فلم يحتمل ليونس عليه السلام ما دون هذا لما أقيم مقام القبض والهيبة، فعوقب بالسجن في بطن الحوت - في ظلمات ثلاث - ونودي عليه إلى يوم القيامة " لولا أن تداركه نعمة من ربه لنبذ بالعراء وهو مذموم ".
Indeed, had Yunus, peace be upon him, not endured what was less than this—when the state of being seized [qabd] and awe [hayba] was established in its place—he would have been punished with imprisonment in the belly of the whale, in threefold darkness, and the call would have been proclaimed against him until the Day of Resurrection: "Had it not been for a grace [ni'ma] from his Lord reaching him, he would have been cast upon the barren shore while blameworthy [madhmun]."

a.g: And his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.
And indeed, those who disbelieve would almost make you slip with their eyes when they hear the message, and they say, "Indeed, he is mad."
But it is not except a reminder to the worlds.
